intro: Corispermum rechingeri, commonly known as the desert cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is a small annual herb with simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by wind. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with a deep root system and the ability to conserve water efficiently. Corispermum rechingeri plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest in studies of plant resilience in extreme climates.
